website_summaries.verdict: The set up on this complete cage places the pitching machine outside the net, protecting the pitcher.
pros: Great size at 30 feet by 12 feet by 12 feet
cons: This is a really big set up, which might make it difficult for some spaces

customer_reviews.title: Price, Quality and Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed/wanted! Good times out there together! Definitely helps!!! Easy set up. Note: attach the string , lay arches down and drape net over arches that are laying down. Simply lift the arches up and netting is perfectly in place. Holds up to strong winds and was left up most of the summer into fall. Highly recommend! Buy the yellow dimple cage balls. It was expensive to try others to finally learn those balls work best.
customer_reviews.author: Kaw Kaw

customer_reviews.title: Assembly
customer_reviews.text: It was a pain to erect this cage (especially on a windy day), make sure you have someone there to give you a hand. I’d suggest you assemble the net first on the ground by using zip ties to the structural components (TRUST ME, You’d thank me later). And then, everything else would be a breeze. Get some bungee cords for support, don’t use the ropes they gave you (once again, you’ll thank me later). Over all, it’s an okay product, kids love it and that’s all what matters.😅
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and attached to make a normal distance batting ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and attached to make a normal distance batting cage. With one, the pitching machine is too close for the players to pick up on the ball.
customer_reviews.author: decaturjohn

customer_reviews.title: Good value, nice backyard system.
customer_reviews.text: Take your time putting it together. It goes together relatively easy, but you’ll get best results if you take your time. The netting is not super heavy duty and after about 2 weeks of consistant use, we have noticed a few holes in the netting. But overall this is a pretty nice back yard system if you have a young baseball/softball player.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Good batting cage
customer_reviews.text: The batting cage is very good. They give you two ropes on each side of cage. I reinforced the cage with one more on each side of cage and on at the top to make sure if it is windy it wouldn't come down. The net is very good. My grandson hits approximately 50 miles and it withstands The force with no damage. The only thing is where the the anchors on the built in pitching machine are they don't line up. There is one on the bottom and one on the side. I use bottom one and tie the top to the pitching machine
customer_reviews.author: darcy

customer_reviews.title: Very Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Took over 2 hours to set up! Advertisment says up in minutes so I thought we could Assemble it and take it down when not in use but clearly that is not an option because you have to tape the poles together yes TAPE! A $200 item that uses tape in its construction! Waist of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this negative stars, I would...
customer_reviews.text: This cage is awful. My 14-year-old son has blown holes through this cage in his first couple of swings. The poles are held together with duct tape and they are very unsturdy. The instructions are terrible and have zero detail on what to do. This cage shouldn't be used by anybody over the age of 10. There is one place on the net with double-nets but balls still blow right through like there is nothing stopping them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria P. Alekson

customer_reviews.title: It is worth the relatively low cost
customer_reviews.text: The batting cage was easily assembled and fits well to the machine from heater sports the power alley. I have bought the yellow balls they seem to work the best. However I had a problem this spring and customer service was polite this evening. I should be getting a call back tomorrow. I will write how they helped me when I find out. But cage is terrific and I do like the batting machine but just have a small glitch that I hope can be corrected. It is in the one year warranty. I purchased in October 2018.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set up for the price. My son and daughters love it (all under 8). We purchased 6 buckets and lids from local Home Depot and filled with sand as we have the cage on cement patio. Works great. If this holds up for a couple of seasons, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: st.julien garcia

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product pic, but worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is a little misleading. It makes the cage look much bigger than it really is. It's a 12x22 which is enough room to hit, but not a lot. We have the pitching machine attached so it helps some. It is very durable though. I'm not exactly sure how bc it uses tent poles for support, but it works. We forgot to take it down recently when a storm came through and it didn't budge. Overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Medley

customer_reviews.title: Not a one man job
customer_reviews.text: The rods and netting were durable; however the 10 pound insert for the pitching machine makes it a difficult task to put together. Let's stop using duct tape on products over $150. Four hours fighting the string assembly, netting, and those gigantic rod loops, I was done. RTS!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a great idea, but its very difficult to properly assemble
customer_reviews.text: Its a great idea, but its very difficult to properly assemble. (And Im a pretty skilled guy.) And it is really flimsy. Its a good buy for 80 bucks. The price for what you get is absurd. do yourself a favor and pass.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: The poles that hold this together are the flimsy poles you see used with pop-up tents. I don't know how they will hold up. With that said, the net is sturdy and the pitching machine ( sold separately ) worls great. When setting it up, make sure the netting isn't inside out, or you will have to flip it to attach the pitching machine. If you plan on pitching to an older kid or use it for catching practice, but two and add them together
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Product very unsturdy
customer_reviews.text: The poles for this cage are very flimsy and almost impossible to even out what they call the tension ropes that hold the net up and connect to the poles. The strings need to be thicker. Thinking about replacing their poles and building my own frame with PVC pipe that go around their stakes. Otherwise this is a no go and will be a return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This alley has been a blessing with having a backyard with a large drop-off. This hooked up to our pitching machine has tremendously helped our girls increase their batting average. love this and would encourage anyone wanting to contain their balls during practice.
customer_reviews.author: Lisat

customer_reviews.title: Nice Batting Cage
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it.... Once you get the net adjusted & tied down, then you're good to go.... Nice batting cage....
customer_reviews.author: C1

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy poles, net tangles
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the price, but the poles are just tent poles that fall over in a breeze. Will eventually put up metal poles on the batting cage and just use the netting.
customer_reviews.author: SkiBreck

customer_reviews.title: A game material!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the heater pitcher and balls and it’s definitely the last piece of the puzzle! With little league being cancelled, this is keeping my nephews up with their A game!
customer_reviews.author: Linette Valdivia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to setup might get the extension in the future 👍
customer_reviews.author: BobnJule

customer_reviews.title: Great batting cage option without major construction work
customer_reviews.text: Really nice batting cage. Setting it up is not difficult, and the design makes it work remarkably well. It's big enough for a teenager to hit balls in using a pitching machine. I would not say it is portable... but in a pinch you could take it down and store it for winter etc.
customer_reviews.author: gadget geek

customer_reviews.title: Not work money
customer_reviews.text: Cost too much for the use on a personal level. Hard to assemble. It took 6 people to but up. Held up good in weather.
customer_reviews.author: holly

customer_reviews.title: worth tbe money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to put together good size length you definitely got something that's going to last for the money you pay
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option.
customer_reviews.text: The design of the machine does not work well with the net. When the ball hits the bottom of the net, it ends up getting tangled to the screw that holds the machine together, which creates a hole in the netting.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not made for adults as was advertised. Bat hangs up in the netting when you swing due to small size.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: The cage took my 14 year old son and his friend several hours to put this cage up but it works great. For those of us that cannot afford a sport's court batting cage this works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of four

customer_reviews.title: Price is good but quality is questionable
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to other reviews, I thought set up was easy. 1/2 hour. It went up fast and the tips about keeping the loops inside made it really easy. Already have one rip I will have to stitch though. Netting material is pretty lightweight and frame is fragile. But,.... for the price :)
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B James

customer_reviews.title: The cage is easily set up and can take a punch from balls
customer_reviews.text: The batting cage is easy to set up and is durable to balls hitting it. It took us 15 mins and cage was up and ready.
customer_reviews.author: hank diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Helped my kids out greatly with batting. I do recommend 2 to 3 people to put it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this, unless you like aggravation
customer_reviews.text: The poles in the box were not half inch as stated but 3/8”. 15 mph wind and that thing was just swaying all over, I was expecting the poles to snap anytime. The net does not fit correctly at all, and it the wind would blow up on one side, NO DOOR or entry. Lift the net really ?? So that it blows up in the wind ?? Hubby Took it down and going to redo with 1” emt and fittings purchased on Amazon ( fittings only ) pipe at Lowe’s. Then rebuild and put in access point so you do not have to LIFT the net to get in. POOR DESIGN OVER ALL !!
customer_reviews.author: LTF

customer_reviews.title: Don't Do It
customer_reviews.text: "Cage" and it's staves is extremely flimsy and is nowhere near as big as it should be. Net is a tangled mess. The pitching machine that's supposed to go with it is a vibrator from the 7th layer of hell.
customer_reviews.author: danno1actual

customer_reviews.title: Not good for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Not to hard to assemble. Didnt come with the eyelets like the picture had to drape over bars. Was up 2 days it rained and had 25-30 mph winds the poles stnapped in half. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great item. We live on the East Coast
customer_reviews.text: Great item. We live on the East Coast, so this item is up from April to almost the middle of Nov. and it takes a beating. The price is right and suits our purposes just fine. Our boys are 11,9,7 and each benefit from having a cage in their backyard daily.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Magee

customer_reviews.title: ... mallet it took about 45 minutes and was very easy. The best part is that we had 40 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my two sons I put it up by myself with a step ladder and a mallet it took about 45 minutes and was very easy. The best part is that we had 40 to 55 MPH winds last night and it did not budge very sturdy stand alone design. Very impressed in Rhode Island.
customer_reviews.author: KJA217

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Ordered another net to add to it to extend it longer though.
customer_reviews.author: sheree

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose, don’t expect too much.
customer_reviews.text: We have used it three times. Put up and take down every time, and the net already has 6 holes in it. Will do it’s intended purpose through the quarantine, but would NOT recommend for any kid over 10.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice product. However the cost and quality truly don’t match
customer_reviews.author: Yanitza Romero

customer_reviews.title: Hard pass
customer_reviews.text: We assembled this exactly 2 weeks ago today. It was a complete pain and took all afternoon with 2 adults. We went outside to use it today to find a pole has already snapped. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Item not user friendly. Assembly directions not clear. Poor quality. Need multiple people to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item, easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, my husband was able to put it up all on his own. Kids love it and the machine pictured fits great with it as described. Shipping was quick and purchase was hassle free. Would recommend for any little leaguer!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Ummm......no....
customer_reviews.text: Wow....just wow. You need 4 patient people and 2 ladders. We never got it up.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cage but recommend a pitching machine to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt fulton

customer_reviews.title: Good value, setup no so easy
customer_reviews.text: Nice batting cage for the money. Just a pain setting up
customer_reviews.author: adam s

customer_reviews.title: Decent cage and pretty easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Decent cage. You definitely want the one that has two cages if you get a pitching machine.
customer_reviews.author: KayORuvolo

customer_reviews.title: batting cage
customer_reviews.text: The net is great, made to take and swag the hits. The poles are flimsy and it creates a dip between the arches of the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken pole after an 8 year old used it only a few times
customer_reviews.text: My son is 8 years old , used this 7-8 times . Pole broke. Not sure how to contact company for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ken moulder

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cage
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow, nice cage, it took about an hour to setup. The machine I bought connects right up to the opening. I recommend this if you are using the slower 40 mph balls, the 60 mph balls are way too fast for this cage. Will be using this quite a bit during the baseball season.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: great product. easy setup
customer_reviews.text: works great. 8,9,11 yearold daughters use it for softball training. drastically improved comfortability and confidence. Good for developing hand eye coordination. Easy to setup and run. Kids do it on there own.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Neuenschwander

customer_reviews.title: Hole in net
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 nets to connect. My son used it the first day and a ball went through the net.... Overall it is pretty cool, however not happy with the hole. My husband had to sew it together.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: We set it up with what came with it and the poles are not sturdy. We bought some wood and made our own cage the net is priced right for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for TEE WORK
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy, if a ball hits a pole it falls down. Ok for Tee work but not good for the machine that’s recommended or even tossing balls to batter.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Turner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Day 2- I am extremely disappointed with the durability of the netting. We have 3 holes in the netting and a whole in my 2 yr old vinyl fencing.
customer_reviews.author: Baseball Mom

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter cage for the young ones. held up very well. would advise to make the stakes a few feet further apart. as there is alot of net bunched up on the ground. It even held the balls I was hitting and im a large man with a ton of bat speed. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a backyard if you want to get your swings in
customer_reviews.text: Love this net very easy to set up. My daughter is an avid softball player likes to get a lot of swings in during the week. got a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and price was right
customer_reviews.text: Best gift I’ve gotten for my granddaughter,she loves it. She’s all star softball 🥎
customer_reviews.author: Donald H.

customer_reviews.title: Holes in the netting
customer_reviews.text: This batting cage we have only had up for one week and it already has three holes in the netting. The netting is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great net, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Can’t use with our pro pitching machine cause it’s only 22’ but it works great with the tennis machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good size and great value.
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty simple to set-up and stays outset. Kids love it - and it has held up really well. Really good size - great price for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Clipperton

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and works great , only took 40 min to put up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product/Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old son loves the cage. The net was a pain to put on... other than that easy set and fun for my son
customer_reviews.author: sarah lester

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. I expected a lot more from this. So flimsy. I would not recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! Not too difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Not too difficult to set up, and our 8 year old loves hitting in his new cage with the pitching machine.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Snipes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but instructions could use some help. My husband is good with putting things together, so it didn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: I am me.

customer_reviews.title: Very weak and crappy
customer_reviews.text: This is a pain to set up. It is overly weak. I would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: dan kensy

customer_reviews.title: Not good netting
customer_reviews.text: The net may be good for little league players but it tears easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Avey

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good speed, but loud @ times. How to adjust frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mike&Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cage it.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful price. Easy to set up. Pitching machine fits great. Love the cage!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D. Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fast easy to put we use it as an inclosure for or indoor cat to put him outside on the grass.
customer_reviews.author: ray hoag

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but could be MUCH improved.
customer_reviews.text: Net material is good, the size is good and it stays up pretty well once up. The design of poles and rope configuration is laughable. Would rather spend an extra $10 and get connected poles (like a tent) that you don't have to tape to keep from coming apart and ropes with clips that connect to the poles at fixed distances. Assembly/Disassembly is MUCH more difficult than it should be. Having loops on every section causes the net to snag as you try to get on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: This batting cage turned out to be better then I though it would be. A little tricky getting it up but works just fine. It is for light balls not real baseballs or softballs. Best for smaller kids with SFT balls or tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: With this item the vaule is in the net, the poles and design with the poles are completely useless. I went to lowes bought 2x4 and built a frame to put the net over. It works a lot better now.
customer_reviews.author: Gaila G.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Yes the direction suck and I had to modify by moving the poles/stackes in a little closer. But my son and his whole competive baseball team loves the batting cage.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Product Is junk. It's not sturdy, will not withstand hits from a 14 year old boy. Tent stake set up seems simple enough, however will not stay up right, and cage will not stay tight
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The price was right!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Christmas gift for a young baseball player that is in training all year round. The price was right...batting cage at Dicks sporting goods-a little smaller and higher dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Arispe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great net. It till about 30 min to assemble and we were hitting.
customer_reviews.author: craig gordon

customer_reviews.title: Love it, it's perfect. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We get so much use out of it. My husband took it down the first year for the winter and put it up again, but winter came so fast this past year that he never got to take it down and only one of the middle bars broke due to heavy snow resting on it but that's not the fault of the manufacturer at all. This was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: ETORRES

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Batting Cage
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together. The design is clearly made for tennis balls or wiffle balls. It is not a baseball cage. It has tent poles framed on the inside, so when you hit the ball it breaks the poles. Trying to modify it with PVC pipe and foam pipe insulation to help support the impact of a baseball. It should be redesigned to frame on the outside (with the net hanging inward like any effective baseball batting cage) with heavier poles
customer_reviews.author: Noah Trosky

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for the price. I bought it for my 8 year old. I do not think the poles would hold up to older kids hitting them. The net is very strong though.It was not as easy as I thought it would be to assemble but overall not to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's also pretty weak material so I don't expect it to last ...
customer_reviews.text: Batting cage is ok. The net took me forever to put on. it's also pretty weak material so I don't expect it to last very long. This cage is good for kids, I would recommend a stronger more durable one for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Star Quest

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my grandson for his eleventh birthday. His mother bought him a pitching machine and I bought the batting cage. He enjoys using both.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne G. Wills

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected
customer_reviews.text: We returned the product. Assembly was not too bad - but it would not stay standing as shown in the picture and certainly would not withstand any wind if left in the yard. The picture shows it inside a building and that probably would be where it works best. We ordered a large soccer goal/ batting net that works much better is easier to put up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Schulzie

customer_reviews.title: I like this cage
customer_reviews.text: I like this cage, works great for my 10 year old. I ordered the refurbished one and all parts looked brand new, instructions were easy to understand and set up was easy. We are using a different pitching machine and we made it work by just putting it inside the net and using the harness to feel the balls through to the machine and so far that is working. I looked around for a while and for a net this size, this is the best price I was able to find.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaN

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grandson likes this but the balls come out too fast for the younger kids
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Woisin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and easy set up. Easy to understand instructions. Very fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value...easy install... we've had a lot of rain and wind recently, the cage has stayed strong.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to set up.. I fit 4 t-ballers in mine (sideways).
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy to set up.. I fit 4 t-ballers in mine (sideways).
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Orellana

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to put up. Frame is flimsy. My son hasn't been able to use not up 24 hours and one end of frame has collapsed. Setup instructions need to be more indepth.
customer_reviews.author: Glenna Lott

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good,
customer_reviews.text: For the price, i am pleased with this product. Is has served its purpose for my 9 year old. i am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R Gruver

customer_reviews.title: Birds get caught in the netting
customer_reviews.text: I installed in my backyard but birds were getting caught in it, I had to cut the netting to free them.. very dangerous for the birds and never warned about this I will bnever requesting a refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: HEATER SPORTS PowerAlley Baseball and Softball Batting Cage Net and Frame, With Built In Pitching Machine Harness For Safety (Machine NOT Included)
feature_bullets: 22 FEET LONG x 12 FEET WIDE x 8 FEET TALL - Perfect Batting Cage for Any Sized Yard and Used By Players from 4 to Adult.
ALL IN ONE PACKAGE - Includes Heavy Duty Ground Stakes 1/2" Fiberglass Rods, 1" Strong Nylon Netting, and Built-In Batting Cage Harness to Attach Any Heater Sports Pitching Machine.

INCREASES YOUR REACTION TIME - Because the cage is 22 Feet, a Ball Pitched at 50 MPH at 46 Feet Will Be Simulated as a 104 MPH Pitch. Imagine How Easy an In-Game Pitch Will Be After Using the Power Alley!
EASY SET UP AND TAKE DOWN - Fiberglass Rods and Light-Weight Netting Allow the PowerAlley to be the Easiest and Most Convenient Batting Cage on the Market. Set Up and Take Down in Minutes!
BUILT-IN MACHINE HARNESS FOR SAFETY - A Built In Batting Cage Harness Allows For a Pitching Machine to Stay Outside Along With the Operator For Safety and Convenience.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
